articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed
articles.title: Exclusive: Iraq to ask U.S. for exemptions on some Iran sanctions
articles.description: Iraq's economy is so closely linked to Iran that Baghdad is going to ask Washington for permission to ignore some U.S. sanctions on its neighbor, Iraqi government and central bank officials said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Bahrain stops issuing visas for Qatari nationals
articles.description: Bahrain's interior ministry said on Tuesday that it would stop issuing new visas to Qatari nationals, escalating measures against Qatar more than a year into a diplomatic row.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Singapore's architectural history under threat from redevelopment frenzy
articles.description: A rush to tear down and redevelop buildings in Singapore has prompted calls to conserve aging properties that symbolize the country's recent history and economic rise.

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.title: Lebanese chafe as economic blues begin to bite
articles.description: For Mazen Rahhal, a shopowner in a bustling district of Beirut, Lebanon's economy has seldom felt more precarious. In one store, he sells clothes at a fraction of their previous price. Another, which he rented to a rival business, now lies empty.

articles.author: Shreyashi   Sanyal
articles.title: Futures gain ahead of planned U.S.-China trade talks
articles.description: U.S. stock index futures rose on Tuesday on hopes that planned trade talks between the United States and China would help resolve the dispute between the world's two largest economies.

articles.title: Foreign automakers oppose Trump NAFTA plan as U.S-Mexico talks resume

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: Fed's solo act faces tremors in Turkey and a slower Europe
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, deep into a cycle of rate hikes it hopes to continue into 2020, now faces emerging risks from abroad that could short-circuit its plans.

articles.author: Makiko Yamazaki
articles.title: Japan's Daikin, thriving in Asia and India, sets sights on Africa
articles.description: Daikin Industries,  the world's largest maker of air conditioning equipment, is turning to Africa for further expansion, 10 years after a successful gamble on sharing its key technology with a Chinese company.

articles.author: Noel Randewich
articles.title: The bull that won't die: S&P 500 back at a record after months on ice
articles.description: After a seven-month stall, Wall Street's bull market looks back on track, thanks to Amazon.com , Alphabet and other high-flying technology and consumer discretionary companies.
